setLights(int, int, int).Description: Set the argb value that you would like the LED on the device to blink, as well as the rate. The rate is specified in terms of the number of milliseconds to be on and then the number of milliseconds to be off.
setLights(int, int, int).FullName: NotificationCompat.Builder setLights (int argb, int onMs, int offMs)

setDefaults(int).Description: Set the default notification options that will be used. The value should be one or more of the following fields combined with bitwise-or: @B_android#app#Notification#DEFAULT_SOUND_E@, @B_android#app#Notification#DEFAULT_VIBRATE_E@, @B_android#app#Notification#DEFAULT_LIGHTS_E@. For all default values, use @B_android#app#Notification#DEFAULT_ALL_E@.

getExtras().Description: Get the current metadata Bundle used by this notification Builder. The returned Bundle is shared with this Builder. The current contents of this Bundle are copied into the Notification each time @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat#Builder#build_E@ is called.

setCategory(java.lang.String).Description: Set the notification category. Must be one of the predefined notification categories (see the CATEGORY_* constants in @B_android#app#Notification_E@) that best describes this notification. May be used by the system for ranking and filtering.

Parameters: int: A resource ID in the application's package of the drawable to use.
setSmallIcon(int).Description: Set the small icon to use in the notification layouts. Different classes of devices may return different sizes. See the UX guidelines for more information on how to design these icons.

setUsesChronometer(boolean).Description: Show the @B_android#app#Notification#when_E@ field as a stopwatch. Instead of presenting when as a timestamp, the notification will show an automatically updating display of the minutes and seconds since when. Useful when showing an elapsed time (like an ongoing phone call).

setRemoteInputHistory(java.lang.CharSequ.Description: Set the remote input history. This should be set to the most recent inputs that have been sent through a @B_android#support#v4#app#RemoteInput_E@ of this Notification and cleared once the it is no longer relevant (e.g. for chat notifications once the other party has responded). The most recent input must be stored at the 0 index, the second most recent at the 1 index, etc. Note that the system will limit both how far back the inputs will be shown and how much of each individual input is shown. Note: The reply text will only be shown on notifications that have least one action with a RemoteInput.

setCustomContentView(android.widget.Remo.Description: Supply custom RemoteViews to use instead of the platform template. This will override the layout that would otherwise be constructed by this Builder object.

build().Description: Combine all of the options that have been set and return a new @B_android#app#Notification_E@ object.

setGroupAlertBehavior(int).Description: Sets the group alert behavior for this notification. Use this method to mute this notification if alerts for this notification's group should be handled by a different notification. This is only applicable for notifications that belong to a @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat#Builder#setGroup_E@. The default value is @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat#GROUP_ALERT_ALL_E@.

Parameters: String: the @B_android#support#v4#content#pm#ShortcutInfoCompat#getId_E@ of the shortcut this notification supersedes
setShortcutId(java.lang.String).Description: If this notification is duplicative of a Launcher shortcut, sets the @B_android#support#v4#content#pm#ShortcutInfoCompat#getId_E@ of the shortcut, in case the Launcher wants to hide the shortcut. @B_android#support#v4#content#pm#ShortcutManagerCompat_E@.

setContentTitle(java.lang.CharSequence).Description: Set the title (first row) of the notification, in a standard notification.

Parameters: String: A URI for the person.
addPerson(java.lang.String).Description: Add a person that is relevant to this notification. Depending on user preferences, this annotation may allow the notification to pass through interruption filters, and to appear more prominently in the user interface. The person should be specified by the String representation of a @B_android#provider#ContactsContract#Contacts#CONTENT_LOOKUP_URI_E@. The system will also attempt to resolve mailto: and tel: schema URIs. The path part of these URIs must exist in the contacts database, in the appropriate column, or the reference will be discarded as invalid. Telephone schema URIs will be resolved by @B_android#provider#ContactsContract#PhoneLookup_E@.

Parameters: int: The accent color to use

setWhen(long).Description: Set the time that the event occurred. Notifications in the panel are sorted by this time.

setOnlyAlertOnce(boolean).Description: Set this flag if you would only like the sound, vibrate and ticker to be played if the notification is not already showing.

setTimeoutAfter(long).Description: Specifies the time at which this notification should be canceled, if it is not already canceled.

setOngoing(boolean).Description: Set whether this is an ongoing notification. Ongoing notifications differ from regular notifications in the following ways: Ongoing notifications are sorted above the regular notifications in the notification panel. Ongoing notifications do not have an 'X' close button, and are not affected by the "Clear all" button.

setShowWhen(boolean).Description: Control whether the timestamp set with @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat#Builder#setWhen_E@ is shown in the content view.

setBadgeIconType(int).Description: Sets which icon to display as a badge for this notification. Must be one of @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat#BADGE_ICON_NONE_E@, @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat#BADGE_ICON_SMALL_E@, @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat#BADGE_ICON_LARGE_E@.

Parameters: boolean: Whether this notification should be a group summary.
setGroupSummary(boolean).Description: Set this notification to be the group summary for a group of notifications. Grouped notifications may display in a cluster or stack on devices which support such rendering. Requires a group key also be set using @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat#Builder#setGroup_E@.

setContentIntent(android.app.PendingInte.Description: Supply a @B_android#app#PendingIntent_E@ to send when the notification is clicked. If you do not supply an intent, you can now add PendingIntents to individual views to be launched when clicked by calling @B_android#widget#RemoteViews#setOnClickPendingIntent_E@. Be sure to read @B_android#app#Notification#contentIntent_E@ for how to correctly use this.

Parameters: int: A resource ID in the application's package of the drawable to use.
int: The level to use for the icon.
setSmallIcon(int, int).Description: A variant of @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat#Builder#setSmallIcon_E@ that takes an additional level parameter for when the icon is a @B_android#graphics#drawable#LevelListDrawable_E@.

addExtras(android.os.Bundle).Description: Merge additional metadata into this notification. Values within the Bundle will replace existing extras values in this Builder.

setSortKey(java.lang.String).Description: Set a sort key that orders this notification among other notifications from the same package. This can be useful if an external sort was already applied and an app would like to preserve this. Notifications will be sorted lexicographically using this value, although providing different priorities in addition to providing sort key may cause this value to be ignored. This sort key can also be used to order members of a notification group. See @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat#Builder#setGroup_E@.

setLargeIcon(android.graphics.Bitmap).Description: Set the large icon that is shown in the ticker and notification.

setChannelId(java.lang.String).Description: Specifies the channel the notification should be delivered on. No-op on versions prior to @B_android#os#Build#VERSION_CODES#O_E@ .

Parameters: Notification: A replacement notification, presumably with some or all info redacted.
setPublicVersion(android.app.Notificatio.Description: Supply a replacement Notification whose contents should be shown in insecure contexts (i.e. atop the secure lockscreen). See @B_android#app#Notification#visibility_E@ and @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat#VISIBILITY_PUBLIC_E@.

setContentText(java.lang.CharSequence).Description: Set the text (second row) of the notification, in a standard notification.

setDeleteIntent(android.app.PendingInten.Description: Supply a @B_android#app#PendingIntent_E@ to send when the notification is cleared by the user directly from the notification panel. For example, this intent is sent when the user clicks the "Clear all" button, or the individual "X" buttons on notifications. This intent is not sent when the application calls @B_android#app#NotificationManager#cancel_E@.

setColorized(boolean).Description: Set whether this notification should be colorized. When set, the color set with @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat#Builder#setColor_E@ will be used as the background color of this notification. This should only be used for high priority ongoing tasks like navigation, an ongoing call, or other similarly high-priority events for the user. For most styles, the coloring will only be applied if the notification is for a foreground service notification. However, for MediaStyle and DecoratedMediaCustomViewStyle notifications that have a media session attached there is no such requirement. Calling this method on any version prior to @B_android#os#Build#VERSION_CODES#O_E@ will not have an effect on the notification and it won't be colorized.

setVibrate(long[]).Description: Set the vibration pattern to use. On some platforms, a notification that vibrates is more likely to be presented as a heads-up notification.

setProgress(int, int, boolean).Description: Set the progress this notification represents, which may be represented as a @B_android#widget#ProgressBar_E@.
setProgress(int, int, boolean).FullName: NotificationCompat.Builder setProgress (int max, int progress, boolean indeterminate)

Parameters: String: The group key of the group.
setGroup(java.lang.String).Description: Set this notification to be part of a group of notifications sharing the same key. Grouped notifications may display in a cluster or stack on devices which support such rendering. To make this notification the summary for its group, also call @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat#Builder#setGroupSummary_E@. A sort order can be specified for group members by using @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat#Builder#setSortKey_E@.

setSound(android.net.Uri).Description: Set the sound to play. It will play on the default stream. On some platforms, a notification that is noisy is more likely to be presented as a heads-up notification.

setNumber(int).Description: Set the large number at the right-hand side of the notification. This is equivalent to setContentInfo, although it might show the number in a different font size for readability.

setSound(android.net.Uri, int).Description: Set the sound to play. It will play on the stream you supply. On some platforms, a notification that is noisy is more likely to be presented as a heads-up notification.

Parameters: int: Relative priority for this notification. Must be one of the priority constants defined by @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat_E@. Acceptable values range from @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat#PRIORITY_MIN_E@ (-2) to @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat#PRIORITY_MAX_E@ (2).
setPriority(int).Description: Set the relative priority for this notification. Priority is an indication of how much of the user's valuable attention should be consumed by this notification. Low-priority notifications may be hidden from the user in certain situations, while the user might be interrupted for a higher-priority notification. The system sets a notification's priority based on various factors including the setPriority value. The effect may differ slightly on different platforms.

setContentInfo(java.lang.CharSequence).Description: Set the large text at the right-hand side of the notification.

setSubText(java.lang.CharSequence).Description: Set the third line of text in the platform notification template. Don't use if you're also using @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat#Builder#setProgress_E@; they occupy the same location in the standard template. If the platform does not provide large-format notifications, this method has no effect. The third line of text only appears in expanded view.

setAutoCancel(boolean).Description: Setting this flag will make it so the notification is automatically canceled when the user clicks it in the panel. The PendingIntent set with @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat#Builder#setDeleteIntent_E@ will be broadcast when the notification is canceled.

setContent(android.widget.RemoteViews).Description: Supply a custom RemoteViews to use instead of the standard one.

setExtras(android.os.Bundle).Description: Set metadata for this notification. A reference to the Bundle is held for the lifetime of this Builder, and the Bundle's current contents are copied into the Notification each time @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat#Builder#build_E@ is called. Replaces any existing extras values with those from the provided Bundle. Use @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat#Builder#addExtras_E@ to merge in metadata instead.

setLocalOnly(boolean).Description: Set whether or not this notification is only relevant to the current device. Some notifications can be bridged to other devices for remote display. This hint can be set to recommend this notification not be bridged.

setTicker(java.lang.CharSequence).Description: Set the text that is displayed in the status bar when the notification first arrives.

ClassDesc: Builder class for @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat_E@ objects. Allows easier control over all the flags, as well as help constructing the typical notification layouts. On platform versions that don't offer expanded notifications, methods that depend on expanded notifications have no effect. For example, action buttons won't appear on platforms prior to Android 4.1. Action buttons depend on expanded notifications, which are only available in Android 4.1 and later. For this reason, you should always ensure that UI controls in a notification are also available in an https:##developer#android#com@B_android#app#Activity_E@ in your app, and you should always start that https:##developer#android#com@B_android#app#Activity_E@ when users click the notification. To do this, use the @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat#Builder#setContentIntent_E@ method.
